website_summaries.verdict: Everyone – even lefties – will love the construction, comfort and fantastic grip of this Orblue pastry cutter.
pros: Stainless steel construction does not break, bend, or rust
Four blades quickly cut butter into dry ingredients and combines wet and dry ingredients seamlessly
Blades are sharp but not overly sharp
cons: Some find that the handle comes apart easily

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had found this sooner....what a find....!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of baking and use a pastry blender to make crusts, blend butter and sugars, make muffin toppings and the like. This, by far is the best blender I have bought. Very good quality, nice grip and excellent cutting blades. I wish I had bought this much sooner. Once I purchased this I also got an email for a free kindle download of recipes (of all types) and when my product shipped I received a coupon code for Orblue. I was very impressed with the item and the service and will definitely look to this company's products in the future....what a find!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen S.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this pastry cutter a year ago, I ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pastry cutter a year ago, I washed, stored it and forgot about it. Last week while making a tart, I remembered that I had it, and decided to use it. The handle came off and I asked my husband if he can fix it ( he fixes everything around the house, including dishwasher, washing machine, kids toys, etc) He look at it and said: forget about it, it is cheap plastic (handle) screw to metal. Definitely I am not a strong person, and this product fell apart first time I use!
customer_reviews.author: Julia Silva

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: This is a (3rd??) replacement pastry/dough blender. For the most part I use them to blend chicken and avocado for a salad recipe. The trouble is the blades always bend fairly quickly and make the job harder but I keep using it until I get fed up and buy a new one. This is a new brand for me and so far this blender/cutter is holding up very well! I'll report back if anything changes but I have high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Coryad

customer_reviews.title: Better Than 30+ Pastry Cutter
customer_reviews.text: This pastry dough blender/cutter arrived on Saturday...just in time for a baking project. It performed flawlessly. I had a pastry cutter that was really old and I loved it but in a move it was somehow lost or <gasp> broken. In this day and age replacing an old piece of kitchen equipment typically equals ending up with something of poor quality. It was not the case with the pastry cutter. It is actually better than the one I owned for 30+ years. Thank you for such a quality item. Highly recommend to beginning and serious cooks.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Ruined a perfect twelve hour sourdough while shaping
customer_reviews.text: Beware!!! Plastic handle will start dissolving over time and contaminate your dough!! Ruined a perfect twelve hour sourdough while shaping. Don't waste you time and money on this product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Make pies for Thanksgiving to sell and last year I broke my food processor in making pie dough from scratch (usually make roughly 60 pies every year). This year decided to try it old school... great move! Saving so much time from taking the processor apart to clean to start a new batch, also I can make an even bigger batch since I'm just using this baby! Yes I so have to add some muscle since now I have to do the labor, but it actually isnt bad at all. Managed to make dough enough for 60 pies in an hour or so. Best investment ever.
customer_reviews.author: Pandapire86

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart on the 2nd time using it
customer_reviews.text: It's the second time I used it. In the middle of mixing my dough, the whole thing fell apart. It made a mess in my kitchen. I'm very disappointed. Despite of its high rating by other buyers, I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Of course it's been a few months since I purchased it. It can't be returned anymore.
customer_reviews.author: OrangeStorm

customer_reviews.title: Best pastry cutter I’ve ever used!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a baker. I raised 7 children and now have 17 grandchildren, so I have a larger than average family. I have always made pies and am still the designated pie maker. This pastry cutter is the best one I have ever used! I love how sturdy it is and how it fits in my hand. It makes short work of cutting the flour and shortening together. I would give it 10 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Scott

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: This pastry cutter was the heavy duty, well made utensil that the reviews detailed. Very happy to have a pastry cutter than doesn't flex and bend due to thin walls and one that has a comfortable handle.
customer_reviews.author: Morning Dave

customer_reviews.title: Solid.  Stainless.  Super.
customer_reviews.text: My partner had emailed the link to this pastry cutter, indicating that it was "similar to what she would like". After reading the reviews, and checking out other options, I returned to this this product and purchased it. I'm quite happy with it.. good, thick stainless steel... sturdy.. but what really sets this apart was the fact that I received a number of (obviously automated) emails from the company, checking it and making sure that I was happy with it. I didn't get that much concern about the quality of the product when I bought my truck... but for a $10 pastry cutter.. I felt that was unheard of. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Jonny B

customer_reviews.title: Solid pastry cutter
customer_reviews.text: This is one solid pastry cutter. It is well built and does a nice job blending butter into flour. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is because the blades are just a touch far apart so I find myself having to push out butter pieces that get caught between the blades. This is really a minor quibble and I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Shemp Howard

customer_reviews.title: Broke on Second Use!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed! This pastry cutter broke after the second time I used it! The black end caps for the handle broke off, and the whole handle came apart. I was in the midst of using it to make a pie crust and was not doing anything vigorous. I had to throw the whole thing away. After reading such positive reviews I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Time saver!
customer_reviews.text: How did I live before this arrived?! I've been making a million empanadas lately. Cutting the dough into equal portions is easy with the provided ruler. The blade is sharp enough to cut through chilled pastry dough easily. After rolling out each disk, I scrape the work surface clean (it takes like two swipes), and dust with clean flour = no sticking! No sticking = less frustration and faster work. And the handle fits nicely in hand.
customer_reviews.author: dpidduck

customer_reviews.title: don't look further, this is the pastry scraper you've been looking for
customer_reviews.text: i love good kitchen utensils and this scraper has the feel of quality. It's just heavy enough to do the job easily without feeling clumsy, nicely balanced - does't "skip" off the surface. great handle that just nestles into your palm. the edges are finely honed with sharp corners so you can get anywhere, or slice dough like "buttah". I love it. i will definitely buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: JudyReene

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first several uses. But then, one day I found black plastic shards in floor. The end caps on the handle broke and then fell off completely. No matter, who needs the little end pieces, right? No. Found additional black plastic shards and then the plastic handle completely broke apart from the metal. Held in place by two very tiny screws; won't last with regular use. Might be fine for occasional it light use.
customer_reviews.author: Xplorin

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: So I cook a lot of pasta and bread. This is a well-made product. It fits my hand well. Sharp cutting edge. I like the measurements on it. I believe it will last a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Alter Z

customer_reviews.title: Broke during second use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cutter in April of this year. I adored the firmness of the handle, no rolling in my hand while mixing cold butter and flour. It seemed very solid. Until the second time I used it. The handle snapped right in the middle of cutting in butter! What junk! I could understand if this thing was a few years old, but this was only the second time using it. Plus add in scraping up my knuckles on the screws sticking out after it snapped, and I really can't recommend this product. Worked good the first time....
customer_reviews.author: Dog-Mom

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in my hand
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pastry blender for almost 5 years now, but in that time, have only used it 5 or 6 times, as I don’t make homemade pastries/doughs often. I have always hand washed it, and dried it immediately. When using it last night, both “end pieces” suddenly broke off and a bunch of rust and broken plastic fell into my bowl of flour and butter. So, given the fact that it has been used so little, and has already fallen apart (and ruined an entire tart crust), I would NOT recommend this item. Very poor quality. I’ll stick with OXO or other reputable brands for my kitchen tools.
customer_reviews.author: PC Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: A really good pastry blender!
customer_reviews.text: This is a review for: Orblue Stainless Steel Pastry Blender. I had been using a pastry blender from the 50's and was afraid to replace it because, as we all know, the old products were just made better than anything we can buy today. NOT SO with this product! It is a well made product that is extremely sturdy with blades that make blending pastry dough easy work. What else is there to say except that I love it and recommend it as a great buy that will last!
customer_reviews.author: JazzyGirlMe

customer_reviews.title: Better than wire cutter
customer_reviews.text: I like this pastry cutter better than my old wire one. The wires would always get bent out of shape and that can’t happen with this one. It works really well for cutting in butter. The only thing I don’t like about it is the handle isn’t very comfortable so if you are using it a lot you notice that. But for small jobs and occasional use it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: C. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Cutting edge product (pun intended)
customer_reviews.text: I'd read about pastry cutters and wondered what all the fuss was about. Then I started baking and learned that, to make a flaky crust, you HAVE to use butter as cold as you could get it. Well, my old two-knife method of cutting butter into flour then became a real (literal) pain, and took a much longer time than before. So I went and bought this little beauty and, let me tell you, it works almost magically! The firmest, coldest butter is quickly incorporated into my flour amount so that the butter is still very cold. Voila! Super flaky crusts resulted. I highly recommend this product. It works and is super easy to clean. It's even dishwasher safe!
customer_reviews.author: ImageWrx

customer_reviews.title: Description says it can be  "POPPED" in the dishwasher, the whole thing came apart.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I washed this in the dishwasher the decal plate on the top of the handle came off, no biggie. The second time the two side plates that hold the handle on came off and the whole thing collapsed. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great... until it broke spectacularly.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this, for a while. Then I found the stainless button from the handle in the dishpan after doing a load of dishes. "No big deal", I thought. It was just decorative. But then the next time I used it, both ends/caps of the handle fell off at the same time, revealing rusty screws inside. Both caps, and one of the screws, plopped straight down into my cookie dough. Ugh. I only used it once a month or so, and hand washed it. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: T. D.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, handy, comfortable and a workhorse!!
customer_reviews.text: Use this so much when I'm prepping, baking and cooking that I'm beginning to think of it as part of my hand. Having the measurements right on the scraper let me see if my pastry it thin/thick enough before its cut or placed in a pan. I use it to cut pastry and veggies alike. (just wash/rinse between). Clearing the board after chopping veggies with it is a breeze, as is the chopping. It sharpens just like my blades. It is so versatile! The handle fits my hand, the blade is wide enough to clear a cutting board handily and its just sharp enough for chopping. And as a pastry cutter it excels.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy about my new pastry cutter. I have been using my Grandmas's cutter for years, but it is very close to falling apart. I want to save it for sentimental reasons, and to pass along. When I received this pastry cutter, I was so pleased. It is even better than I was expecting. The handle is perfect, and the cutter is nice and heavy. I will use it for many baking preparations, but I will also use it for egg salad, tuna salad, and other salad preparations. Don't hesitate to order, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy. Falls apart within a few uses. Has major design flaw.
customer_reviews.text: I fell for all the paid reviews and bought this product. I generally try to buy things which will last a long time. This pastry cutter was used to make at most 5 - 6 pies and it is already falling apart. The major design flaw is that there are two plastic caps on both sides of the handle, which fall off. Once they fall off the handle also falls off shortly. Many of the 1 star reviews complain about the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: S V N Vishwanathan

customer_reviews.title: Works but breaks easily.
customer_reviews.text: My first one worked for the first pie crust. My boyfriend used it for the second crust and the entire contraption fell apart. They promised to refund entirely and then all of a sudden I got a new one in the mail and email that they'd rather replace it. I don't know if my boyfriend was just too rough, but they seem nice enough and the product worked when it was me using it. I haven't opened the replacement yet.
customer_reviews.author: Nikita

customer_reviews.title: Really Sharp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a grocery store cutter we'd used for years. The design looks good and it worked well. However, I recommend using it in a glass bowl. The blades are sharp and cut pieces out of my wife's brand new Tupperware bowl, when I made pie crust. She was nice about it, but not thrilled. My pie crust turned out great, once I picked out the pieces of pink plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd William Shell

customer_reviews.title: Biscuits are fluffy!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable hand grip, and the blades easily cut through chilled butter. It is actually fun to work with! I am gluten free, and for the first time in three years had fluffy drop biscuits that I got out of Gluten Free on a Shoestring: Quick and Easy, and with the help of this wonderful device. It kept the butter cold, so that the biscuits could be nice and fluffy! Did I mention the customer service from Orblue? As soon as I made the order they sent me a thank you email, and kept an open dialog with me throughout the shipping. They were a very nice company to work with, and I will definitely be ordering from them again!
customer_reviews.author: cdsky3

customer_reviews.title: I was making potato salad and needed to mash a few a bit finer so I grabbed this Cutter
customer_reviews.text: It does a bit more than Cut Pastry Dough. I was making potato salad and needed to mash a few a bit finer so I grabbed this Cutter. Listening to Music and Rockin' away I noticed I'd moved on from the potatoes and moved through the Onions and Celery as well.. I looked at this solid fisted hand tool I was gripping with Satisfaction and had one of those fuzzy moments realizing I'd made a new kitchen friend. It is Solid. Sharp. But not overly so. And does not dull inside a Steel Bowl.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Weak handle
customer_reviews.text: This pastry blender only lasted for about 6 uses. Halfway through blending butter into flour this morning, the handle busted. The end caps on the handle popped off into the flour. I tried to pick out the plastic bits, but there were too many little plastic specks. I had to throw it all away, pastry blender included. One star.
customer_reviews.author: Regal Beagle

customer_reviews.title: Pastry Blender
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this pastry blender now that I have had a chance to use it for a couple of different recipes. It was purchased to replace the one that has been plaguing me for years. Unlike that one, this is very sturdy and blends fat into flour very well. The stainless is thick so it doesn't get all bendy with cold butter. The handle is not affixed with tiny, annoying little screws so it does not come loose all the time. A well made, sturdy blender.
customer_reviews.author: P. Woodland

customer_reviews.title: ORBLUE Pastry Cutter Stainless Steel - Professional Baking Dough Blender with Blades
customer_reviews.text: This PASTRY CUTTER makes cutting butter into floor much easier than a couple of table knives, and it is sturdy, and easy to wash by hand. Dave
customer_reviews.author: jib

customer_reviews.title: Great cutter, wish the tabs didn't fall off
customer_reviews.text: Update: Broken. I bought this 18 months ago and I used it maybe five or six times. Yesterday the other plastic bit fell off, and the entire handle just collapsed. I'm going to try an all-metal one next. Disappointing. The best cutter I've used, but still has the annoying issue of the plastic tab falling off the sides. Maybe I cut my dough too vigorously but I always seem to have this issue. Aside from that these are great. The thick metal blades are so much better than the flimsy wire type, and the handle is substantial. Hopefully it will still work with the plastic tabs off.
customer_reviews.author: ALH

customer_reviews.title: An excellent addition to my kitchen tool kit.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to cut fats into my biscuit dough. In the past, I had always used my hands, but I worried that I was working (and therefore melting) the fats too much with that method, so I decided to give this a try. Overall, I am very pleased. Butter, especially cold butter, will gather and clog on the top side of the blades, mostly on the ends, but this is quite easy to remove. So in the end I am getting the benefit that I had hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Greg G

customer_reviews.title: Handle comes apart
customer_reviews.text: I chose this pastry cutter because it looked sturdy. Well, the business end is sturdy, but the handle is not. It is slowly coming apart. Part of the plastic handle-end cover fell off into my pie crust just now (I removed the plastic from the dough, don’t worry!). Hoping someone can recommend a me that won’t fall apart. The blade section is fine ... maybe my husband can rig up a wooden handle ...?
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I inherited an old one from my grandma & It was giving up the ghost - the wires were all bent, the handle would give me splinters, and paint would chip off and fall into dough. So figured it was time for a new one. I purchased this one and man is it nice! So easy compared to my old one!!
customer_reviews.author: Layla Manning

customer_reviews.title: Great pastry cuttter
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this pastry cutter. I host an annual family 'pie day' before thanksgiving. We make a half dozen apple pies and a dozen one crust pies for extended family gatherings. The pie crust is the most important part of the pie making process. My old cutters suffered from 'flexible ' blades, loose handles, and overall floppy mechanics. This one has a fantastic grip and the cutting blades are STRONG. As pie day progressed, everyone was fighting over this pastry cutter. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dmccar3636

customer_reviews.title: I’m alerting you on how much my daughter loved the Pastry Scraper (as expected)
customer_reviews.text: Christmas is over and as promised, I’m alerting you on how much my daughter loved the Pastry Scraper (as expected)! Since nearly all the professional chefs and cooks on TV now use scraper’s in the kitchen, my daughter wanted to be as up-to-date and professional in her home kitchen as they are. Therefore, upon opening her gift, she was absolutely delighted and on my visit on New Year’s Day, she proudly showed me that she had really used it and had even washed it in her dishwasher! Delighted is an understatement of her love of this new accessory in her kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Broke after the first use
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this and put it to work immediately. After a few strokes the pastry cutter completely fell apart. I wouldn't recommend this product. It does not hold up well to the pressure needed to cut butter in a flour mixture.
customer_reviews.author: doejubois

customer_reviews.title: Finally a tool that works
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a blender, food processor, and my bare hands, and I couldn't get my butter and flour correct. Either it was pulverized to the point where my dough was overworked, gummy from the heat of my hands, or flat from the butter pieces being too large and melting right out. This utensil has FINALLY helped me get what I want from my biscuits and pie crust. The butter does get caught up a little, but I pick it out and keep going. It's so cheap too but well made. My advice: skip the expensive equipment and get this.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole C

customer_reviews.title: All scrapers are not created the same
customer_reviews.text: I already had and use a stainless steel scraper that is a single piece of metal with one end rolled to form the handle. I like that there is no wood or plastic to clean or have break off. That being said, this handle is so much more comfortable to hold. The blade itself is also a sturdier and thicker steel (with appropriate edge). The wait gives more oomph to the scraping and also when dividing dough etc. Well worth the price (just under $10 on sale at the time of this writing).
customer_reviews.author: Michael GrantTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: If you really need a pastry cutter ......
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this pastry cutter based on all the good reviews and the reasonable price, as my shortbread recipe said I HAD to use a pastry cutter (instead of my usual system of two knives) to cut the butter and flour together for a fine breadcrumb texture. This pastry cutter is dishwasher-safe, which is a big plus, and the handle is comfortable to hold, not the hard metal that you see on other pastry cutters. Shipping was fast. Overall, a nice little tool (though I think my basic two-knives system for cutting the butter and flour might have worked just as well for me!)
customer_reviews.author: HappyTexasGal

customer_reviews.title: must have for pastry cooks
customer_reviews.text: this thing works great for cutting in butter or coconut oil into flour. it's bullet proof, and perfectly balanced. ideal for smaller batches when you don't want to get the big mixer out, or you don't want another silly electrical thing in your life. wash immediately for easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: ehdy

customer_reviews.title: almost great
customer_reviews.text: Solid metal, nice blades, sturdy handle, great cut. Unfortunately, build quality doesn't stand up to 3 years of average kitchen use. There are tiny little screws that hold the handle on and over time they work loose and the screw hole threads have stripped. A nickel more on better screws would rate this among the best
customer_reviews.author: Shektek

customer_reviews.title: It cam packaged very well and was in perfect condition. I am very happy with this Dough ...
customer_reviews.text: My Orblue Professional Dough Blender arrived the other day. It cam packaged very well and was in perfect condition. I am very happy with this Dough Blender. I like it's shape and size and the way the comfort grip fits my hand. It is a little smaller than the old one I had and fits very nicely in the bottom of my bowls. I love how sturdy it is. It should handle cold butter very well and anything else I want to blend with it. It is just as I hoped it would be and overall I am very satisfied. I would recommend this dough blender to anyone needing one.
customer_reviews.author: Barb H

customer_reviews.title: GREAT DOUGH BLENDER
customer_reviews.text: I have a three year old grandson who I have been babysitting since birth and since I love to cook have had him in the kitchen helping since he was 18 months old. He LOVEs to cook with me. I had an older dough blender that was to difficult for him to use. I ordered this one and it makes blending dough by hand SO much easier for him. We are making goodies for the holidays and doing so with a three year can be challenging. I do recommend this dough blender if you are looking for something that makes the job easier.
customer_reviews.author: musicgenes

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy, well-made pastry blender. I priced them at local retail stores and couldn't believe the pricing for a baking tool I use infrequently. I found this lower priced one on Amazon and decided to take a chance...and I am glad I did. Buy it, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Corday W.

customer_reviews.title: Help for Pie Makers
customer_reviews.text: I used this pastry cutter on Thanksgiving to make my homemade pie crust. After using a quite flimsy one, as I was just trying to get by, I finally ordered a new one. I would heartily recommend this pastry cutter to everyone. It is very strong and did a beautiful job of cutting through all the shortening and flour as I was making my crust. I only wish I had ordered it long ago and saved myself a lot of poor pie making.
customer_reviews.author: DAR

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Terrible Amazon Shipping
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so heavy duty, it held up despite Amazon sending it in its box that had been crushed by something prior to putting it in the corrugated shipping carton that was undamaged. The products packaging was so mangled it couldn't have been inspected prior to leaving the warehouse because we had to pull the packaging apart in pieces just to get to it. Besides being a heavy duty pastry cutter, my wife says it's great for mashing strawberries for shortcake. She likes the rubber coated oval grip much better than her old wooden round grip since it's easier on her arthritic hands.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: The best pastry cutter.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned so many through the years. This is the best one I've ever worked with. I'm a professional chef, and I make a lot of dough. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: WesleyMarsh

customer_reviews.title: Love the Orblue Stainless Steel Pastry Cutter!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Orblue Pastry Cutter. The sturdy steel construction makes it slice through frozen butter as easy as pie. The handle is very comfortable in my hand even through I have significant arthritis issues. This one does it all, works great, easy to use, and easy to clean too. I will be making a lot more pastry and pies now that I have this wonderful kitchen tool. If you are thinking about investing in a pastry cutter this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Helen J. Schaal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Dough Blender. Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this recently after using a similar item at my sisters. I am so glad I bought this one, it works terrific. I just used it this past Saturday and I was extremely impressed with the ease of use. I suffer from an auto immune disorder which affects my joints and this wonderful tool made my life better with its use. I would highly recommend this product for anyone who is looking for a great way to mix crumbles and graham cracker crusts or any other dough uses you can imagine.
customer_reviews.author: Susan A. Taylor-Fahnestock

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: So...I'm sitting at the Wisconsin State Fair with my girlfriend. We both are repeat Culinary Challenge entrants in the fair. She's telling me about this product and says she can't live without it. I pull out my phone, order one and it arrives quickly. It's sturdy and appears to be well made. Last Monday I used it to smooth out the frosting on a cake and it worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Savivi

customer_reviews.title: A perfect pastry cutter
customer_reviews.text: I finally had to admit after 10+ years it was time to replace my pastry cutter. It had cut and blended many a pie crust, biscuit, scone and crumble topping. Based on the reviews I purchased the Orblue pastry cutter. I seriously love it! It's small like my old one so it fits well with my mixing bowl. The grip fits my small hand perfectly. The thick blades cut through shortening and butter amazingly quickly. Plus with a bit more space between the blades it makes it easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Ret Chief Wife

customer_reviews.title: Super kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: The Orblue Pastry Cutter Stainless Steel - Professional Baking Dough Blender with Blades is the best pastry cutter our family has ever used. Over the years, we've purchased and used many other brands of pastry cutters. This particular product is very high quality, durable, well made and ergonomically designed to fit and feel good in our hands. We love using this product and highly recommend it to anyone who is currently using another type of pastry cutter. We've received excellent and personal service from the co-founder and team, prompt delivery and excellent packaging. :-)
customer_reviews.author: BAZIC

customer_reviews.title: Buy this, you won't be sorry (especially if you bake).
customer_reviews.text: I do a LOT of research when I purchase items- especially when adding to my kitchen. This item was highly recommended and I can see why. It works great, it is well constructed, does what it should, cleans easily. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a pastry cutter (can use to chop nuts also). This cuts through and mixes very well. Many other brands have problems with not being ergonomically a good fit or falling apart. This comes out ahead of the others!
customer_reviews.author: Paulina

customer_reviews.title: It cuts the butter (and flour)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a while ago and finally used it today...cutting cold butter into 3 cups of flour. My old pastry blender would have buckled, but this one stood up to the work. I love its sturdiness and the wider blades...makes short work for pie crust and pastry. I'm glad I bought it and would recommend it, highly.
customer_reviews.author: Judith A Loue

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your Money!
customer_reviews.text: First when getting it, It's SMALL! When your hand is holding on the handle and you use it, your knuckles end up in the dough. Handle is to close to the Blades! And after using it twice and washing it. Rust start bleeding out of the end Caps. Had to take out the CHEEP Rusted screws. And install New Stainless Screws!!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P.Gorski

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful pasty cutter to make pastry a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I've had cheap flimsy pasty cutters, the kind the wire loops bent and couldn't cut through solid butter ever. I finally decided to try a more solid design, and what a difference. The handle is easy to grasp, the solid sides keep the pastry in the cutter and not up the sides. The cutter is great, very solid, cuts through butter, flour, sugar and brings together a topping in no time. My only regret with this pasty cutter is that I didn't get it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Becky at the beach

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 years...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 2 years, almost to the day. On average was used 10x per year, so sadly not impressed. Screws that held handle onto metal blender ripped right out and the plastic was stripped so no hope of fixing it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay DeCosta

customer_reviews.title: Is this all there is?
customer_reviews.text: Worked the first time I tried it without undue bending or deformation . It's easier than cutting butter into sugar with a fork, potato masher, fingers. Still, I had expected a more robust tool for "professionals". Handle end-caps popped off immediately, they were glued on (plastic to metal - sounds durable, huh?) I wonder what professional bakers use.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Schoenbach

customer_reviews.title: piece at top pops out
customer_reviews.text: This pastry cutter does the job, but the top handle is not one piece and the top of it pops off. this makes it harder to hold and uncomfortable in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: T Gorman

customer_reviews.title: A TRULY PROFESSIONAL KITCHEN TOOL
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and cleans up well. Truly a professional kitchen tool. Use it several times a week and making pastries is a breeze. Recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Skeptical Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Strong, durable, great pastry cutter. Already used it to make 7 all butter pies, two crust each and have barely had the cutter a week. I use one inch cut frozen butter; two sticks her dough recipe. And this pastry cutter helped me reduce my pie crust time in almost half compared to my other cutters. If you prefer hand made versus electric appliance this is the most practical, dependable cutter for a great cost.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: It had 5 whereas this one only has 4 but these 4 blades are super strong with no "give" - excited to keep practicing ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing will make biscuits for days! My old blender/cutter had blades that kept bending into each other and warping. It had 5 whereas this one only has 4 but these 4 blades are super strong with no "give" - excited to keep practicing my biscuit recipe with this!
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after less than 10 uses
customer_reviews.text: The handle is attached to the blade by tiny screws, one on each side (two total). The screws are about a quarter inch long. How to I know this? because I had to pick them out of my pie dough after the handle fell off during use.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: Updated review
customer_reviews.text: Used as an aid in making my awesome scones. 1st use was cutting half a pound of nearly frozen butter. So much better than using the chef's knife as before. That's as far as I got. My gas oven won't light no matter what tricks I've tried😭 Finally my oven igniter worked. Finished my scones today & this cutter/scrapper was extremely helpful. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Raoul Paré

customer_reviews.title: Good and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This thing cut s through cold butter like a hot knife. Sturdy, easy to clean, a little awkward to hold after using it for several minutes, but works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Maria DiFi

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a very old one I've had for nearly 20 years. The old one was getting loose at the handle. This one is very nice quality and feels like it will also last a very long time. The scraper isn't thin and wobbly at all. Nice and sturdy - does the job quite well. I wish the scraper were just a little longer to the handle but it does what I need it to do very easily. I would buy this again and recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: L. Buring

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I've had a pastry cutter for years and thought it was about as good as it gets. Wrong. This is about as sturdy as it comes. The blades don't bend or make me furious as I'm trying to make pie dough, and I'm able to work the fat into the flour quite well while still leaving plenty of small chunks of butter for a perfect crust. It also works exceptionally well for making egg salad with a great texture and no wads of boiled egg whites. I didn't think I needed this until I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A. MadsenTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: This is the only pastry cutter you'll ever need!
customer_reviews.text: This pastry cutter is superb quality. Can't believe all the money I previously wasted on cutters that bent with very little pressure. It's comfortable in my hand and is easy to use. And I can't believe the low cost for such an extremely well made kitchen tool. The customer service provided was exceptional, too. The company followed up with me after delivery to make sure I was happy with the product. Totally unexpected. They also provided a link to an ebook of recipies. Would definitely buy again for gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Orblue Pastry Scraper / Cutter
customer_reviews.text: Best Scraper / Cutter EVER. I received this today and almost immediately put it to work making a ridiculously thin french pastry. With my old cutter / scraper - eh - it would not have been near as effective as this. It's sharp, just the right width and extremely well balanced. I also really like the measurement printed on the blade - it's handier than I thought it would be. It is also very easy to clean (and I got it really messy :o) ) ... I should have gotten the pkg of 2 :-/
customer_reviews.author: Loralei Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Quality Pastry Blender
customer_reviews.text: The pastry blender is just what I needed! It works really well, is a good quality. I used this pastry blender to cut shortening into flour for biscuits for biscuits and gravy. Then used it again to cut butter into flour for a cookie recipe. I love to bake and this really makes it easier. Thanks bunches... Nadine Korhonen
customer_reviews.author: Nadine Korhonen

customer_reviews.title: I am glad to say that the order blue pastry cutter is ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the same pastry blender for over 40 years – it belong to my mother. But it was worn out and I needed a new one. I am glad to say that the order blue pastry cutter is a wonderful addition to my kitchen. I have tested it twice now on pastry dough and it works wonderfully mixes the Dell perfectly in my pies came out perfect. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who loves to bake
customer_reviews.author: K. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Lately I've been on the quest to make perfect biscuits, and purchasing this gadget was part of ...
customer_reviews.text: Lately I've been on the quest to make perfect biscuits, and purchasing this gadget was part of it. Straight out of the package, it appears well made and sturdy. The biscuits also came out wonderful -- as I have a tendency to over-knead if I use my fingers. Very happy with this pastry cutter. It is just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: lisa marie

customer_reviews.title: The quality is great. Good stainless steel with a handle that fit ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great. Good stainless steel with a handle that fit the palm of my hand comfortably. The blade edge is tapered making it easy for cutting through dough but not sharp like a knife blade, so you're not likely to get accidental hand cuts. I have used it for for slicing dough and as a pastry board scraper for easy cleanup. The blade has handy ruler markings along it's edge, one side in inches, the other in centimeters. I recommend buying this item.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several pastry cutters and find this one to be superior to any I've owned previously. The cutter is sturdy, no give which works best for cutting solids into the flour and the grip fits comfortably in my hand. I do a lot of baking for friends and family so have used this for dozens of cookies and biscuits. I would buy another to have on hand but can tell that this one is going to last for many years. A must for bakers.
customer_reviews.author: Skookum

customer_reviews.title: Too short!
customer_reviews.text: It cuts dough very well, but there's not enough room between handle and cutting edges, and the dough gets all over your hand.
customer_reviews.author: SusieQ

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: His hung is awesome I bought it for making pie dough but now I also use it For ground meat or even mashed potatoes
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Martin

customer_reviews.title: Orblue pastry cutter has other uses!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pastry cutter to chop and mash cooked beans. I know this sounds a bit odd, but I eat a whole food, plant based diet, so consume beans in some form most every day. Many recipes call for mashing the beans with a fork, which is rather tedious. Recently, I heard a person talking about using a pastry cutter to mash beans, so I ordered the Orblue pastry cutter.. Well, it works extremely well, and is much faster and more comfortable than using a fork. I also used it to mash up some potatoes (with skins) and it worked very well for that, as well. This tool will get a lot of use, for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This doesn't seem like a design issue
customer_reviews.text: The actual cutting blades aren't very evenly spaced. This doesn't seem like a design issue, but a manufacturing control issue-- the inner blade bends at a different angle than the outer ones. Not a huge deal, it'll cut through flour and butter I'm sure, and I don't need to worry too much about additional bends since the material it's cutting through will be soft. But I'd like to see a product that puts every bit of care into making sure that the cuts it makes are extremely consistent. Good for the price, but it could definitely be better. Also... who uses a pastry blender to make pasta? Seriously weird product photos.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Mmeeh
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be a bit over-designed, the handle (black rubber) is not that comfortable and the oval shape makes your fingers to be closer to the dough than with a more basic pastry scraper. Also, it is to sharp for me, It seems that they tried to make a very versatile product that you could use for a lot of things, sacrificing some of the basic features.
customer_reviews.author: Tiago San

customer_reviews.title: Best Pastry Cutter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pastry cutter for my farmers market booth where I sell my scones. When I first began I was using my hands to blend the butter into the flour. Knowing how time consuming that was I pirchased the Orblue pastry cutter after comparing it to others on Amazon. I absolutely love it. The blades cut he butter perfectly every time and it does so quickly. It's also very comfortable to hold. I'm very glad I bought this cutter, it has made making my scones and biscuits A breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen scraper is a win
customer_reviews.text: I use it mainly to scrap chopped onions into the saute pan. No more excuses for cut fingers anymore. I don't use it as a cutter- that's what my chef's knife is for. The ruler measurement on the side is handy also for keeping certain veggies uniform for presentation purposes. Dishwasher safe, although I use it through out the day and wash it immediately after use. Well constructed, it's still intact after 2 months of nearly daily usage.
customer_reviews.author: sanjayf

customer_reviews.title: Pastry is Bread, The Cutter is Orblue, But with it I dont know what to do.
customer_reviews.text: New to pies New to this tool, I have always used two butter knifes or a fork, so this seems to clog and fill with the dough. I am sure this is just me but I will keep on keeping on. It is the nicest cutter I have seen in my entire life. If ever a guest in my home needs one of these I will not be embarrassed to let them use this one.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift, so have not tried it myself, but I may well buy another for personal use. The dough blender appears to be of excellent quality, strong metal with a soft,comfortable handle. It was nicely packaged in a box for easy wrapping. I received several friendly emails from the seller tomake sure I was satisfied.A nice purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and strong
customer_reviews.text: I started out with the most basic of pastry cutters (two knives) and I've slowly moved up the ranks of tools until I came upon this. It was smaller than I anticipated and honestly I thought it wouldn't be that great, having borrowed my mom's which was much bigger. Wow, was I proven wrong! I get done mixing much faster and I even tested it beside hers and bragged a bit about it. She continues to live in denial...but I think we both know that this pastry cutter is pretty great. I'd recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: Nice and strong, makes quick work of butter/flour mixing (also helped with my guacamole in a pinch) blades do not bend like the wire version. Highly recommend, and no, this is not a review of a free product, I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah H.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy but the blades seem to be a little too ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy but the blades seem to be a little too far apart. Doesn't cut shortening into flour as quickly as old one did, but it didn't last- blades broke. This one is very sturdy- great quality. It is also a little harder to clean if you don't pay attention, you'll miss something.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Ford

customer_reviews.title: Makes your Dough easier than ever!
customer_reviews.text: This pastry cutter is designed for someone with fairly large hands, yet my wife, who has petite hands can use it equally as well. The grip is non-slip allowing good pressure and movement. Great addition to a baker's kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Hampton Lawyer

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for your kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Well designed. Lightweight but very sturdy. Very efficient. I don't know what I did before I had this nifty little pastry cutter. Oh, sure I do. I used two knives the way my grandmother taught me way back when. My mother's "improvement" of forks was no better. No comparison with this tool. It's a must-have. Delivery was no-hassle and right on time.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: A Great Cut Up
customer_reviews.text: Don't you enjoy a tool useful outside its designed role? We prepare alot of food for hungry workers at this time of year. They enjoy pulled smoked pork, turkey hash, shredded barbequed brisket, green chile with barbacoa, etc. This "pastry cutter" is our go to for shredding meats. Also great for pastry to top that peach pecan cobbler in the dutch camp oven.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This pastry cutter does not have the longevity I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pastry cutter two years ago--I only use it 2-3 times per year, for making Thanksgiving pies and the (very) occasional batch of scones. When not using it, I store it in a drawer and always hand wash it to clean. About a month ago, the pastry cutter began to get very loose--a plastic piece from the handle keeps falling off and the cutter is very rickety whenever I try to use it. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: So happy I lost my old one!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a pastry cutter than got "lost" and I bought this to replace it..and what luck it was to have lost the old one..this one absolutely is the best!! It cuts the fat into the flour perfectly and is so comfortable in the hand! the sides make it very ease to blend right to the sides of the bowl..no problem with over working it does such a great job. I recommend it highly..it's the best!!! Would be a great gift for anyone who loves to bake!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Walters

customer_reviews.title: Look no further for an excellent pastry/dough blender!
customer_reviews.text: This is one sturdy blender -- the weight/balance of it doesn't slip around in the bowl -- it just gets the job done. The non-slip grip is nice, too. The size of the blender handle fits my (smaller) hands better than my previous one.
customer_reviews.author: Claire W.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Broken in the First Week
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Broken in the first week. Will not hold together. I have to rebuy a different brand because this is going in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to hold and I'm glad I got this one ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been meaning to replace my pastry cutter that broke and read reviews here on Amazon. Decided on this one by Orblue. After using this can't believe I waited so long to replace my old one. I make scones quite a bit and have to cut in the butter and this made quick work of it. It is easy to hold and I'm glad I got this one as it seems sturdy, and as I said easy to grip. A keeper!!
customer_reviews.author: Carsok

customer_reviews.title: Orblue Pastry Cutter Stainless Steel
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best dough blender I have ever used. I am extremely pleased with the feel of it in my hand and how it works the dough. I have used many dough blenders, even to the point where they have fallen apart. I think this one will take a very long time for that to happen -- if ever. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Twiga

customer_reviews.title: Buy Orblue!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the pastry cutter because of arthritis in my fingers and it's difficult to hand mix anything. I love this pastry cutter! It makes any dough mixing so easy. The folks at orblue are very interested in their customers and service is great. Everyone needs to check Orblue out. You won't be disappointed! I did purchase this at full price and my comments are my own personal opinions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Orblue Dough Blender Pro - Premium Stainless Steel Pastry Cutter with 5 No Flex Blades - Large Size
feature_bullets: 🍪 THE ONLY CUTTER YOU'LL EVER NEED - The Orblue Stainless Steel Dough Blender is a total game changer for your kitchen! Anyone who bakes needs this tool in their baking drawer. Cutting and blending dough is now a breeze, whether you’re making pizza dough, pastries, pies or biscuits, whilst also being perfect for mashing fruit or potatoes.Both you and your partner will agree that this gets the job done!

✅ USE WITH COMPLETE EASE - Our ergonomic handle has been engineered for both ultimate precision and comfort. 100% non-slip with grips that are indented specifically for your fingers, the Orblue Dough blender allows for the strongest grip for the smoothest dough mix!

😍 NEVER WASTE TIME AGAIN - Our new no flex innovative technology means that our cutter is fitted with the sturdiest and sharpest blades. It won’t bend or flex, it just cuts right in and makes your job 100% easier and quicker. Perfect for both professionals and home baking lovers!

🚿 NO MORE MESS - The Orblue cutter does the job with minimal effort and is much faster than cleaning a food processor. SO easy to clean, all it needs is a quick rinse with soap and water, or can be popped in the dishwasher for an extra sparkle!

🎁 LIFETIME GUARANTEE - We pride ourselves on offering the best customer service and we know you'll LOVE your new dough blender. We're so confident that we offer a worry free LIFETIME money back guarantee, just email us if you have any issues at all and we'd love to help!
